user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_m_algo:
```c
static enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3
get_m_algo (void)
{
  if (force_md5)
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_MD5;
  else if (force_sha256)
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_SHA256;
  else if (force_sha512_256)
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_SHA512_256;

  /* No forced algorithm selection, let MHD to use default */
  return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_ANY_NON_SESSION;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
else if (force_sha256)
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_MULT_ALGO3_SHA256;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated as shown. The else-if branch is reachable unless the surrounding boolean flags are compile-time constants that force the earlier return. A specific violation scenario would be if force_md5 is a compile-time constant that is always true (e.g. #define force_md5 1 or static const int force_md5 = 1), in which case the preceding if always returns and the else if (force_sha256) return ... becomes unreachable.
